word_mean: 氮：无色气体元素，游离于空气中，符号为N
比重0.9713，原子序数7，原子量14.007。为大气的成分，占空气的4／5。化学上几乎为惰性，但结合后可形成硝酸与氨。对生物，氮很重要，是蛋白与核酸的成分，因而存在于所有活细胞内。它是在呼吸中无用的气体
虽无毒性，但只吸入氮气却可致死，因为缺少氧气，它能溶于血及体液内，当大气压降低时，即以气泡游离出来，能造成严重症状。见sickness项下的decompression　sickness
〔NF〕氮气：按体积含N2量不少于99％，在药物制剂中用来替代空气
nitrogen-oxide ana-lyzer 分析大气中一氧化氮、二氧化氮等氮氧化物的仪器。

sentence.Network_en: The atmosphere consist of more than 70 % of nitrogen.
sentence.Network_cn: 大气中含有70%以上的氮气.

sentence.Network_en: Every tonne of coal contains, on average, 30 kilograms of nitrogen.
The plant requires nitrogen in order to make proteins.
sentence.Network_cn: 植物需要氮以便制造蛋白质.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 18th cent.: from French nitrogène (see nitro-, -gen)

entry.def: Nitrogen is a colourless element that has no smell and is usually found as a gas. It forms about 78% of the earth's atmosphere, and is found in all living things.

means.word_mean: 1. a common nonmetallic element that is normally a colorless odorless tasteless inert diatomic gas; constitutes 78 percent of the atmosphere by volume; a constituent of all living tissues
